name: onshore petroleum field infrastructure construction | onshore petroleum field infrastructure | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4568/documentation

This activity represents the construction of an onshore production field with 100 wells for extraction of crude petroleum oil. Lifetime 20 years.;For onshore production, several hundred production sites (wells) are summarized to one production field. The inventory is estimated for a field with 100 drilling sites and described in more detail in Schori & Frischknecht (2012) and Jungbluth (2007). Oil and gas processing are done centrally, which requires pipes and pumps.;Onshore production requires space for pumps, separators, tanks, pipes, energy generation (for internal electricity production) as well as cleaning processes (particularly wastewater treatment). In this study a value of 1000 m2/drilling is used.;Meili et al. (2021, section 6.4) assume that the lifetime of the land use change is only 20 instead of the formerly estimated 30 (oil) or 50 (gas) years. This assumption is based on analysis done for horizontal wells in Oklahoma US.;Reference(s): C. Meili, N. Jungbluth, M. Bussa (2021) Life cycle inventories of crude oil and natural gas extraction. ESU-services Ltd. commissioned by the Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) and the â€œVerband der Schweizerischen Gasindustrie (VSG), Schaffhausen, Switzerland, DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.29142.78409, http://esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/

This activity starts with the transformation of land (forest assumed).

Materials for construction and energy use for construction. Land use and transformation. Drilling of the wells is not included and hence considered separately. Manufacturing of facilities partly not included.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/09:Mining support service activities/091:Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction/0910:Support activities for petroleum and natural gas extraction

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data for materials and land use based on information from 1990. New data for energy and material uses during construction.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for fields in RU, US and multinational companies.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Onshore crude oil production in the Northern hemisphere.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Applied to all onshore operations. Data vary considerable depending on infrastructure necessary to access the place of production. No data for Middle East. It is assumed that the lifetime of the land use change is only 20 instead of the formerly estimated 30 (oil) or 50 (gas) years. This assumption is based on analysis done for horizontal wells in Oklahoma US. Here, more than half of the production of oil and gas, which is projected for the total lifetime occurs during the first three years of operation. A lifetime of 20 years might be too low for exceptionally large oil fields, such as Rumaila in Iraq. Therefore, by using this estimate, the impact of land use might be slightly underestimated for the dataset for Iraq. However, for most of the globally accessible, smaller oil fields, this estimate seems appropriate. (Meili et al. 2021, section 6.4)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Publication in environmental reports and other literature. The inventory is estimated for a field with 100 drilling sites and described in more detail in Schori & Frischknecht (2012) and Jungbluth (2007).
